ticket.subject: RE: APP/TPO/Q3630/8846 - Decision
ticket.description:
Good morning,

 

Thank you for your email.

 

As stipulated in the cover email below, all post decision correspondence must be sent to feedback@planninginspectorate.gov.uk, rather than to the casework team. I have CCâ€™d them in to this correspondence.

 

Regards,

George Nichols

 

 

George Nichols | High Hedges Casework Manager

Trees & High Hedges Team

The Planning Inspectorate

Ensuring fairness, openness and impartiality across all our services

 

This communication does not constitute legal advice.

From: Teresa Stembridge <tww@live.co.uk>
Sent: 01 November 2022 16:22
To: Tree and Hedge Appeals <Treeandhedgeappeals@planninginspectorate.gov.uk>
Subject: Fw: APP/TPO/Q3630/8846 - Decision

 

Good afternoon Mr Nichols.  We were, as we're a lot of the neighbours around the property, very disappointed to receive this rejection. It seems very harsh that the Inspector confirmed and agreed that the lack of light in the gardens and inside of the properties, the debris and the severe shading would cause severe lack of enjoyment and fulfilment to their living but this was dismissed in favour of the wider appeal of the tree - from people not affected at all by any of the negative impacts of the tree.  The comments we had received were from neighbours in the road and those around it .... it wasnt just 20, 22 and 24 Bishops Way occupants. 

 

The Inspector also seems to be discussing the affects of the tree on the residents of the properties immediately next door to the property where the tree is sited, but mostly states conditions on nos 20 and 22 .... whereas the properties mostly affected are 22 and 24 ...... it seems the Inspector has mixed the properties up and the condition and negative affects stated for no 24 is completely wrong. No 24 is highly affected, especially with the conservatory ..... 

 

We are very concerned that some confusion has occurred and that an injustice has been served on the neighbours at no 24. In fact on the day of the visit I am told that the Inspector only asked about no 20 and did not even attempt to knock at no 24 or speak to anybody there. Why would no 20 be so concentrated on when it is no 24 that is so much more affected EVERY SINGLE DAY in how they can live their lives. I understand that they have even had an application for solar panels refused due to the tree! No 24 is the neighbour much more affected and yet the report states that that garden is not overhung, not as shaded and not got debris from the tree or birds!  This is totally incorrect. 

 

Teresa Stembridge 

-------------------------------

From: Teresa Stembridge <tww@live.co.uk>
Sent: 12 September 2022 18:45
To: warren@sherwoods.info <warren@sherwoods.info>
Subject: Fw: APP/TPO/Q3630/8846 - Decision

 

 

-------------------------------

From: Tree and Hedge Appeals <Treeandhedgeappeals@planninginspectorate.gov.uk>
Sent: 12 September 2022 16:49
To: tww@live.co.uk <tww@live.co.uk>
Cc: planning@runnymede.gov.uk <planning@runnymede.gov.uk>
Subject: APP/TPO/Q3630/8846 - Decision

 

Good afternoon,

 

I enclose a copy of our Inspector's decision on the above appeal.

 

The appeal decision is final unless it is quashed following a successful challenge in the High Court on a point of law.  If the challenge is successful the decision may be quashed but the case will probably be returned to the Secretary of State for re-determination.  However, if it is to be re-determined, it does not necessarily follow that the original decision on the appeal will be reversed.

 

Please note that the Planning Inspectorate is not the administering body for High Court challenges.  If you would like more information on the strictly enforced deadlines for challenging, or a form to lodge a challenge, please contact the Administrative Court on 020 7947 6655.

 

If you have concerns or queries about the decision or the way we handled the appeal(s), please visit our Feedback and Complaints webpage. Please quote the appeal reference number in any correspondence.

 

If you do not have internet access you may write to the Customer Quality Team, Room 3B Eagle Wing at the address above. Alternatively, if you would prefer hard copies of our information on the right to a Judicial Review and our feedback procedure, please contact our Customer Service Team on 0303 444 5000.

 

Regards,

 

George Nichols

 

 

 

George Nichols | High Hedges Casework Manager

Trees & High Hedges Team

He/Him
The Planning Inspectorate

T 0303 444 6742
